attributes.action: grant Alhassan Bangura leave of stay in the United Kingdom
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Alhassan Bangura (19) has had his application for leave of stay in the United Kingdom turned down by the Asylum and Immigration Authorities.

He has immediately appealed with the full backing fo his club, Watford FC

Bangura was trafficked from Sierra Leone at the age of 15 and upon arrival in the United Kingdom was subject to a sexual attack, before seeking refuge as an unaccompanied minor.

Bangura has worked hard to build a social and domestic life, create a stable environment for his family and contribute hugely to society through not only his football, but also his voluntary community work.

Bangura fears a return to his homeland, where personal circumstances dictate his life may be under threat from the Soko tribe, whom his late father was once head of.

Bangura knows of no immediate family in Sierra Leone and would be forced to leave behind his girlfriend and nine-day old son Samal.

(Source: Watford FC)

rejection.details: Individual cases are a matter for direct correspondence with the Home Office.
reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
